title: Support ctrl+c signals for windows applications launched from WSL/bash
body: In short: Make ctrl+c interrupt / kill windows applications launched from WSL.

comments.body: This is easily noticeable for anyone running a web application with ASP.NET Core using dotnet.exe from Bash. Ctrl+C appears to kill the process until you run it again and it throws an error that the port is already in use.
This is possibly more easily noticeable if you run notepad.exe from bash, then Ctrl+C it - the notepad window stays open.
